page.title: 15UPTON VILLAGE
page.content: The village used to have its own smithy but this has closed. A blacksmith came for a time after the last war for one day a week but now people with horses usually have the blacksmith call at their own farms. Farming has changed considerably and become much more mechanised with a resulting loss of jobs, those that used to be done by a few men now being done by one machine. Some jobs are provided by the tourist industry, one farm near the village doing bed and breakfast for about Â£8 per night or Â£10 with an evening meal. They also offer a tea making and baby sitting service. You can also rent a holiday bungalow that sleeps five people for Â£65 - Â£120 per week in the high season.
